messages.content: I just feel like I'm not good enough, you know? No matter what I do, it's never enough."
It sounds like you have some pretty negative thoughts about yourself. Can you tell me more about that?

Yeah. I guess I just feel like I'm always falling short, no matter what. Like, I'll work really hard at something and then it turns out bad or someone else does it better than me and it just feels awful.
That doesn't sound like a very positive way to view yourself or your accomplishments. What do you think might be causing these negative thoughts?

I don't know. Maybe it's just how things have always been for me. Whenever something goes wrong, it feels like it's all my fault somehow. And even when things are going well, I just don't feel good enough somehow.
That doesn't sound like a very healthy way to live your life. Are you willing to try and change that?
Yes, I think so. It's just really hard sometimes to see myself in a positive light when everything around me seems so negative. But I'm willing to try if it will help me feel better about myself.
Well, let's start by exploring some of the reasons why you might feel this way. Do you think there are certain situations or events that trigger these negative thoughts?
Yeah, I guess so. Like I said, whenever something goes wrong or I don't meet my own expectations, it really bothers me.
So it sounds like you're pretty hard on yourself. Can you think of any other times when you might feel this way?
Yeah, I guess any time I'm compared to others or have to compete with someone. It just makes me feel really inferior and not good enough.
That definitely sounds like a lot of pressure that you're putting on yourself. Would you be willing to try and let go of some of that pressure? Maybe give yourself a break every once in awhile?
Yeah, I think that would help. Just knowing that I don't have to be perfect all the time would take a lot of the stress off.
"That's definitely a good idea. Why don't we try some relaxation techniques to help you let go of some of that tension and stress?
Counselor: So, what's been going on that's been causing you to feel so angry?"
It's just everything, you know? I feel like I'm constantly being put down or ignored. And it all just builds up until I can't take it anymore and I lash out.
Do you have any specific examples of what's been going on?

Well, my boss has been riding me pretty hard lately. And my wife doesn't really seem to understand how stressed I am. She's always telling me to relax and not take things so seriously. But how can I relax when everything feels like it's falling apart?
It sounds like you're feeling a lot of pressure from both your work and your home life. Is there anything you can do to reduce the amount of stress you're feeling?
I don't know. That's why I'm here, I guess. I need help figuring out how to deal with all this anger before it destroys my life.

Well, let's start by exploring where this anger is coming from. What do you think is causing it?
I'm not really sure. That's one of the things I want to figure out.
Okay. Let's try to look at it from a different perspective then. What are some of the positive things in your life?
Well, I have a great family and friends. And I love my job, even though it can be stressful at times.
It sounds like you have a lot of good things going for you. So why do you think the negative things are impacting you so much?
I don't know. They just seem to be magnified right now and I can't shake this feeling that everything is falling apart.

"It sounds like you're feeling very helpless and hopeless right now. But it's important to remember that you're not alone in this and there are people who care about you and want to help you through this difficult time.
I'm not sure where to start."
That's okay. We can start anywhere you'd like. How are you feeling today?
I feel really scared and alone. I don't know what to do or where to go from here.
It sounds like you've been through a lot. Do you want to talk about what happened?
I was raped by my ex-boyfriend. I thought he loved me, but he hurt me so badly. I don't know if I can ever trust anyone again.
I'm so sorry that happened to you, Ahron. It wasn't your fault and you didn't deserve it. You are not alone in this – we will support you through this process and help you heal.
Thank you. Just knowing I'm not alone makes me feel a little better.
What would you like to do next? We can take things at your pace.
I think I need some time to process everything. But I'd like to keep talking to you – I feel like you understand what I'm going through.
"That's perfectly understandable. We can schedule another session for next week if that works for you. In the meantime, here is a list of resources that might be helpful for you.
So I've been thinking about what you said, and I'm really interested in the schools you mentioned. Can you tell me more about them?"

Of course! Let me pull up some information on each of them. So, these are the schools that we think would be a good fit for you based on your interests and academic profile. [The counselor then proceeds to give Jeb more information about each school, including statistics, programs of study, student life, and anything else Jeb might be interested in.]
That's really helpful, thank you. I think I'm going to apply to all of them!
Wonderful! We'll be here to help you through the process every step of the way.
Thank you so much for all your help. I really appreciate it.
"You're welcome, Jeb. Good luck with everything!
I just don't know what to do. I feel like I'm stuck in this rut and I can't get out."
It sounds like you're feeling very helpless and hopeless right now. Can you tell me more about why you feel this way?
I don't know...I just feel like my life is a mess and it's never going to get better. I'm always screwing up and messing things up. I just feel so lost.

It sounds like you have a lot of self-doubt and negative self-talk going on. We can work on that in counseling, but first, let's try to identify some of the specific things that have been causing you to feel this way. Are there any particular events or situations that stand out to you?

Well, I guess one thing that's been really bothering me lately is my job. I hate my job, but I feel like I can't quit because I need the money. And even if I did quit, I don't know what else I would do with my life. So that just makes me feel even more stuck.

It sounds like your job is a big source of stress for you right now. That's definitely something we can work on in counseling. Are there any other areas of your life that are causing you stress or making you feel unhappy?

I guess another thing that's been bothering me is my relationship with my boyfriend. We've been together for a few years, but lately it feels like we're just drifting apart and he doesn't seem to care about me anymore. That really hurts and makes me feel really alone.

"It sounds like your relationship is another source of stress for you. Let's talk more about that in our next session. Are there any other areas of your life that are causing you stress or making you unhappy?
I just don't know what to do. I feel so lost."
It sounds like you are feeling overwhelmed and uncertain about your future. Can you tell me more about why you feel this way?
It's just everything. School, my parents, my friends. I don't know who I am anymore. I used to be so sure of myself but now I feel like I'm just floating through life without any direction.

That sounds very difficult. But it's also common for people to feel like this during adolescence as they are trying to figure out who they are and what they want in life. So you are not alone in feeling this way.
Yeah, I guess that makes me feel a little better knowing that other people have felt this way too. But it doesn't make it any easier dealing with it myself.

No, it doesn't make it easier but understanding that this is a common experience can help you to not feel as lost and alone in your feelings. Adolescence is a time of great change and can be very confusing and scary at times but ultimately it can also be a time of great growth and discovery if we allow ourselves to go through the process.
Yeah, I guess that makes sense...I'm just afraid of making the wrong choices or taking the wrong path in life and ending up somewhere I don't want to be..

Yes, making decisions can be scary but ultimately we all have to make them whether we want to or not. And sometimes we do end up making choices that we later regret but that doesn't mean that we are bad people or that our lives are ruined forever because of them. We all make mistakes and learn from them as we go through life. What's important is that we try our best to learn from our mistakes and not repeat them in the future."
Yeah, I guess you're right. I just need to try and not let myself get so overwhelmed with everything and trust that I'll make the right choices eventually.

"Exactly. Trust yourself and your ability to make decisions. You are capable of making good choices and you will learn from your mistakes as you go through life. Just take things one step at a time and don't put too much pressure on yourself.
I guess I've just been carrying around a lot of anger and pain, you know?"
Yes, it sounds like you have. Can you tell me more about your childhood and your parents' divorce?

Well, my parents got divorced when I was young, and it was really tough on me. I felt like I had to choose sides between them, and I always felt like I was the one who was left out. My mom would always talk about my dad in negative ways, and it made me feel really angry towards him. And then when he would try to reach out to me, I would just push him away because I didn't want to deal with him either. It's like I've been carrying around this resentment towards both of them for a long time.

That makes sense. It sounds like you experienced a lot of pain during your parents' divorce. Do you think counseling can help you learn how to express yourself better so that you can share your feelings with your friends?

"Yeah, I think so. I just feel like I've been holding everything in for so long that it's hard for me to let go of it all. But if counseling can help me learn how to do that, then I'm definitely willing to give it a shot.
I'm not really sure if I'm ready to talk about this stuff. It's just, I feel like I've been avoiding my problems for so long and I don't want to face them head-on."
Well, avoidance can sometimes make things worse. Maybe it would be helpful to talk about what's going on and see if we can work through some of these issues.
Alright, I guess you're right. It's just hard for me to open up about this stuff.
That's perfectly understandable. Why don't we start with something easy then? Can you tell me a little bit about your childhood?

Yeah, I guess that makes sense. Well, I grew up in a pretty small town and my parents were always really supportive of me. But even though things were generally good, I always felt like there was something missing in my life. Like there was this hole inside of me that I couldn't fill no matter what I did. So eventually, I started turning to drugs and alcohol to try and numbed the pain. And that's when things started going downhill...

It sounds like you've been through a lot. And it makes sense that you would turn to drugs and alcohol to numb the pain. But it's important to try and find healthy ways to deal with your feelings. Otherwise, it can be easy to get caught in a spiral of addiction.
Yeah, I know. I've been trying to quit for awhile now, but it's just so hard. I feel like I'm always one step away from relapsing.

"Recovery is a difficult process, but you're doing the right thing by seeking help. Just remember that relapse is always a possibility, but as long as you're willing to keep fighting, there's always hope for a better tomorrow.

I'm feeling really optimistic about my future right now. I've been working hard in therapy to overcome my past trauma and I feel like I can achieve anything I set my mind to. It's been a long journey, but I'm finally starting to feel like myself again."
That's great to hear, Crista! It sounds like you've made a lot of progress. What do you think has been the most helpful for you in your journey?

I think just having someone to talk to who understands what I've been through has been really helpful. Just being able to express how I'm feeling and knowing that someone is there for me has made all the difference. Counseling has definitely helped me find hope for the future and given me back some self-esteem.
That's great to hear! It sounds like counseling has been a really positive experience for you. What are your goals for the future?

I just want to be happy and healthy. I want to continue working on myself so that I can be the best version of me. I also want to help others who have been through similar experiences. I know how hard it is to overcome trauma, but I believe that anything is possible if you set your mind to it.
"That's an admirable goal, Crista. I think you're going to achieve great things in your future.
I'm really struggling right now. I feel like I'm not good enough for anything."
It sounds like you're feeling a lot of self-doubt. Can you tell me more about why you feel this way?

I don't know. I just feel like I'm not smart enough, or pretty enough, or anything enough. And it's especially hard right now because I'm in college and I'm surrounded by all these people who seem to have their lives together and know what they're doing. And I just feel so lost and confused.

It's understandable to feel this way in college. There is a lot of pressure to succeed and it can be overwhelming at times. But that doesn't mean that you're not capable of succeeding. You are smart and capable, and you can do this. Remember that everyone feels lost at some point in their life, so you're not alone in how you're feeling. Just take things one step at a time and don't be too hard on yourself. You'll get through this
Thank you. Just talking to you has helped me feel a little better.
"I'm glad I could help. If you ever need to talk, don't hesitate to reach out to me.
I don't know if I can do this."
You can do this, Kiyana. You've been through a lot, but you're strong. You can get through anything if you set your mind to it.
I'm scared that people are going to judge me.
People are going to judge you no matter what, Kiyana. But you can't let that stop you from living your life. You need to learn to accept yourself for who you are and move on with your life.
I don't know if I can do that.
"Yes, you can. You're a strong person, Kiyana. You can do anything you set your mind to.
I'm really struggling right now. I don't know how to deal with everything that's going on."
What's going on?
My dad died a few weeks ago and I can't stop thinking about it. I keep reliving the moment when I found out and it's just so hard.
That sounds really tough. How are you sleeping?
Not well. I have a lot of nightmares about my dad dying. In the nightmares, he's always in pain and gasping for breath and there's nothing I can do to help him. It's just so awful.
That does sound very upsetting. Have you been talking to anyone else about how you're feeling?
Yeah, I've talked to my mom and my friends but it doesn't really seem to help. They all say that time heals all wounds but I don't see how that could be possible in this case.

Well, it might not happen overnight but eventually, with time and healing, those intense feelings will start to fade away and you'll be able to think about your dad without feeling so overwhelmed with sadness. What are some things that make you happy? That you enjoy doing?
I like playing video games and hanging out with my friends. But lately, even those things haven't been making me feel better like they used to.

Maybe what you need is some more time before jumping back into your hobbies full force again. Grief can be exhausting both emotionally and mentally, so it makes sense that your energy levels would be down as well. Just take things one day at a time for now and focus on taking care of yourself both physically and emotionally."
Thank you. That actually makes a lot of sense. I think I need to take some time off from work and just focus on taking care of myself for a while.

"That sounds like a good idea. Make sure to keep communicating with your loved ones and let them know how you're feeling. It can be really helpful to talk about your dad and memories you have of him with people who understand what you're going through.
Counselor, I really appreciate you seeing me today. I've been struggling a lot lately with anxiety and it's been really tough to manage."
That sounds very difficult, Brecken. Can you tell me more about what has been going on?

Yeah, sure. It's just been feeling like my anxiety is out of control and I can't seem to get it under control no matter what I do. I'm constantly worrying about things and my heart races all the time. It's just really tough to deal with.
It sounds like you're feeling very overwhelmed by your anxiety. Have you tried any coping mechanisms or relaxation techniques?
Yes, I've tried a few things but nothing seems to help. I just can't seem to calm down no matter what I do.
Well, let's explore some other options then. Have you ever considered medication for your anxiety?
No, I haven't really considered that option. I'm not sure if I'm ready to go that route yet.

"That's perfectly understandable. Medication isn't right for everyone. But it is something we can consider if other options don't seem to be working. Let's keep exploring different options and see what might work best for you.
I don't know why I'm here. I feel like I've been through enough counseling to last a lifetime."
Britny, it sounds like you're feeling overwhelmed and hopeless. Can you tell me more about that?

It's just...I thought I was doing better. I thought I had everything under control, but lately it feels like everything is falling apart. My friends are moving on with their lives and I'm just stuck in the same place.
It sounds like you're feeling left behind and like your life is stagnant. That can be really tough to deal with. Have you been trying to reach out to your friends or connect with new people?

Yeah, I've been going to some social events but it's not the same as having close friends that you can rely on. And lately it feels like everyone is so busy with their own lives that they don't have time for me anymore.
"That can be really tough to deal with, especially if you're already feeling isolated and alone. Maybe we can brainstorm some ideas of ways for you to connect with people and build new relationships?
I've been thinking a lot lately about how I used to feel so in control of my life and I really want to get back to that place."
Why do you think you lost that sense of control?
After my mom died, I felt like everything was out of my hands. I was just going through the motions and trying to hold myself together. I wasn't really living, I was just surviving.
It sounds like you're feeling more like yourself again now. Is there anything in particular that's helped you feel more in control?

Yeah, actually there is. I've started going to therapy again and it's been really helpful. Just talking about what's going on and how I'm feeling has helped me feel more in control of my own life again.
I'm glad to hear that therapy is helping you. What else do you think would help you feel more in control?

I don't know. That's something I've been thinking about a lot lately. I guess just taking things one day at a time and not getting too ahead of myself. Just focusing on the present and what I can do to make myself happy right now.
That sounds like a good plan. Are there any other areas of your life that you're struggling with feeling out of control?

Yeah, I guess my relationship is another thing. We've been together for a while and it's just not making me happy anymore. But it's hard to break away from something that's familiar, even if it's not good for you.

Yes, it can be very difficult to end a relationship, even when it's not healthy. But sometimes it's necessary in order to move on and find happiness again. Have you given any thought to what you would like to do?

"Yeah, I think I'm ready to end things. It's just hard because we have so much history together and we were really good at one point. But I know this is the right decision for me and I'm ready to move on.
I don't know what to do. I feel so lost and scared all the time."
What are you afraid of?
I'm afraid of failing. I'm afraid of not being good enough.
Why do you feel like that?
I don't know. It just seems like everything is so hard and I can't do anything right.
Do you want to talk about what's been going on lately?
Yeah, I guess so.
"Okay, let's start with what's been stressing you out the most.
I don't know what to do. I feel so lost and alone."
It sounds like you're feeling really isolated right now. Can you tell me more about what's going on?

Well, I had a big argument with my partner recently. We just couldn't see eye to eye on anything and it left me feeling really hurt and alone. I feel like I can't rely on anyone, and the future seems bleak.
"That sounds very difficult. It's normal to feel lonely after an argument like that, especially if you felt misunderstood or unsupported. What can we do to help you feel better in the present moment?
I don't know why I started starving myself. It just seemed like the only way to control my life."
Why did you feel like you needed to control your life?

I just felt so out of control all the time. My parents were always fighting and I didn't have any friends at school. I just felt like if I could control what I ate, then that would be one thing that I could control in my life.
Aubrei, starvation is not a way to gain control. It's actually a very dangerous form of self-harm. You're lucky that you were found before it was too late.
Yeah, I know. It's just hard to stop when you've been doing it for so long.
"Well, let's work on that together, okay? We'll find other ways for you to cope with your feelings and learn how to make healthy choices for yourself.
I'm really angry. All the time. It's like, I can't help it."
Cecile, let's talk about what's making you angry. What are some specific things that are causing you to feel this way?
I don't know. Everything, I guess. My parents, school, my friends...it all just sucks sometimes.
It sounds like a lot of things are bothering you. Do you want to talk about any of them in particular?
I don't know...I guess my parents are the biggest thing right now. They're always on my case about something and it just gets really old after a while.
It sounds like you're feeling frustrated with your parents. Can you tell me more about that? What specifically are they doing that is causing you to feel this way?
They're just always on my back about school and my grades and what I'm doing with my life. I can't do anything right in their eyes.
Cecile, it sounds like you're feeling like your parents are constantly criticizing you and that they're never happy with anything you do. Is that accurate?
Yeah, pretty much.
Cecile, have you ever talked to your parents about how you're feeling?
No...I don't really know how to bring it up. And even if I did, they'd just tell me I'm overreacting or something.

"Cecile, it sounds like you're feeling very alone in how you're feeling right now. That's not uncommon, but it is something we can work on together. Would you like to try talking to your parents about how you're feeling? We can role-play a bit if that would make it easier for you.
I've been through a lot in my life and I want to work through my problems. I feel like I need to talk to someone who can help me sort out my thoughts and feelings."

Yes, Miquel, that is a good idea. Counseling can be very helpful in processing difficult life experiences and working through trauma. Tell me what has been going on in your life that has led you to seek counseling services at this time.

Well, I was recently in a car accident that was really traumatic for me. I'm still having a lot of anxiety and flashbacks about it. My family has also been going through some tough times lately. My parents are getting divorced and it's been really hard for me to deal with.

Miquel, it sounds like you have experienced a lot of stress and trauma in your life recently. It's normal for you to be feeling overwhelmed and confused right now. Counseling can help you make sense of what you're going through and start to work through your feelings about it all.
Yeah, I think that would really help me. I've been feeling really lost lately and like I don't know how to deal with everything that's going on.

"Miquel, it sounds like you are feeling a lot of grief right now. Counseling can help you process your grief and start to move on. It's okay to feel sad and scared right now. We will work through all of those feelings together in counseling.
I'm really struggling to get through each day. I feel like I can't cope with my life."
It sounds like you're feeling overwhelmed and hopeless. Can you tell me more about what's going on?
I just feel like everything is so hard. I can't do anything right and I'm just so tired all the time. I don't know how to make it through each day.
It sounds like you're feeling very down and helpless. That must be really tough to deal with. Have you been struggling with this for a while?
Yeah, it feels like forever. I don't know what to do anymore.
"Well, let's see if we can work on some coping strategies together, okay?
I can't believe I'm here. I've never been to counseling before."
It's perfectly normal to feel overwhelmed and lost after losing your job. Can you tell me a little bit about how you're feeling?
I just feel so lost. I worked so hard for so long, and now I don't know what to do next. Everything feels like it's falling apart.

It's understandable that you would feel that way. Losing a job can be a very stressful event. But it doesn't have to define you or your future. What are some things you're interested in? What are some skills you have that could be translated into another field?
I don't know...I've always loved writing, but I don't know if that could ever be anything more than a hobby. And my customer service skills are pretty good, but other than that, I don't know...

There are many options available to people with excellent writing and customer service skills. Have you considered freelance writing or starting your own business? There are many online platforms where businesses are looking for writers and customer service representatives. With the right skillset, there's no reason why you couldn't be successful in those fields.

"Yeah...I guess that makes sense. It's just hard to think about starting over again after working so hard for so long in one field...but maybe this is an opportunity for something new and different. Thanks for talking with me, it really helps to put things in perspective
I'm not sure if counseling is going to help. I've been down lately and nothing seems to be going my way."

Gibson, it sounds like you're feeling helpless and hopeless right now. But I want you to know that you are not alone. We all feel like this at times in our lives. The difference is how we deal with those feelings. Counseling can help you learn how to cope with your feelings and improve your self-image.
I don't know if I'm worth the time or effort.

Gibson, you are worth the time and effort. We all have moments where we doubt ourselves, but that doesn't mean we should give up on ourselves. You are capable of great things, and I believe in you. With some work, I think you can start to see yourself in a more positive light too.
I'm not sure if I'm ready to open up yet.
That's okay, Gibson. We can take things at your pace. There is no pressure to share anything you're not comfortable with. I just want to help you in any way I can.
Thank you, counselor. Just talking to you has already made me feel better.
"I'm glad to hear that, Gibson. Let's talk again soon, okay?
I don't know what to do. I feel so lost and frustrated."
Why do you feel that way?
Because nothing seems to be going right in my life. Everything is a mess and I can't seem to fix it.
What specifically is causing you distress?
It's everything! My job, my relationships, my mental health...everything is just a big mess right now. I feel like I'm drowning and I can't seem to find my way out.
That does sound very difficult. Do you want to talk about specific examples of what is going on in your life that is causing you distress?

Sure. I guess one big thing is my job. I hate it. I'm completely unfulfilled and it's just really frustrating. My relationships are also a mess. I'm constantly fighting with my significant other and it's just really draining. As for my mental health, I've been struggling for a while now and I feel like I'm at my wit's end. Nothing seems to be helping and I just feel so lost.

Thank you for sharing that with me, Arjun. It sounds like you are going through a lot right now. It's understandable that you would feel overwhelmed and frustrated in your current situation. Do you have any ideas of what you could do to start making some changes?
Not really...I feel like I've tried everything and nothing has worked so far.
"Well, let's brainstorm some ideas together then and see if we can come up with something that might work better for you.

I'm feeling really good these days. I feel like I'm finally getting a handle on things. Stress isn't such a big deal anymore and I'm able to just let it roll off my back. I don't know if it's the counseling or what, but something has definitely changed and I'm really happy about it."

I'm glad to hear that you're doing better, Keaira. It sounds like the counseling is really helping you to cope with stress in a more healthy way. Can you tell me more about what you've been doing that's been helping you?

Well, one thing that's been helpful is just learning to recognize when I'm starting to feel overwhelmed or stressed out. Once I can identify those feelings, it's easier for me to take some deep breaths and relax myself before things get too out of control. That always used to be my biggest problem, is that I would get so stressed out and then everything would just snowball until I was a total wreck. But now I feel like I can nip it in the bud before it gets too bad.

That sounds like excellent progress, Keaira! Being able to identify your stressors and then take steps to prevent them from getting too overwhelming is a great skill to have. Do you think you'll be able to continue using these techniques even when things get tough?
Yeah, I think so. It's definitely not always easy, but I feel like I'm getting better at it. And even when things do get tough, I know that I can always come talk to you and that really helps too.
"That's great to hear, Keaira. I'm always here to help you in any way I can.
I'm feeling really down lately. I don't know what to do with myself."
It sounds like you're going through a tough time. Can you tell me more about what's going on?
I just feel like I can't do anything right. My job is stressful, my relationships are falling apart, and I just feel like a total failure. I don't know how to fix any of it.

It sounds like you're feeling overwhelmed and hopeless right now. Those are normal feelings to have when facing difficult challenges, but it's important to remember that you can control how you react to your emotions. You don't have to let them control you.
I'm not sure how to do that. It feels like everything is just spiraling out of control.
Let's start by breaking down your challenges one by one. What is the most pressing issue you're facing right now? We can work on a plan to address that issue and then move on to the others.
I guess my job is the most pressing issue. I'm in danger of losing it, and I don't know what else I would do.
OK, let's focus on that then. What specifically about your job is causing you stress?
It's just really demanding and I'm constantly under pressure. I feel like I'm never doing enough, no matter how hard I try.
That sounds very difficult to deal with. Have you talked to your boss about how you're feeling?
No, I don't want to seem like I can't handle the job. But it's really starting to affect my mental health and my personal life.

That's a valid concern. It's important to communicate with your boss about what you're experiencing so they can understand how best to support you. Perhaps there are some adjustments that can be made to help relieve some of the pressure you're under.
"I hadn't thought of that... maybe talking to my boss would help me feel better about the situation.. thank you for suggesting it
I just don't know how to stop. Every time I sit down at a table or put money into a slot machine, I just feel this urge to keep going until I've won big or lost everything."
Well Areli, gambling addiction is a very serious issue. It can ruin your life if you let it.
I know that. I've seen what it's done to my finances and my relationships. But I just can't seem to stop myself.
That's why you need to get help. There are counselors and support groups that can help you overcome your addiction.
I'm not sure if I'm ready for that yet.
"That's okay, Areli. Just take it one day at a time and reach out for help when you're ready.
I'm really struggling lately. I feel like I'm not good enough and my life is a mess."
It sounds like you're feeling pretty down about yourself. Can you tell me more about why you feel this way?
I don't know, I just feel like I'm not doing anything right. Everything seems to be going wrong and I can't seem to fix it.

It sounds like you're feeling pretty helpless right now. Page, let me tell you something, you are not alone in feeling this way. A lot of people feel like they're not good enough or that their life is a mess at some point in time. The important thing is how you deal with those feelings and what you do to change your situation. Page, from what you've said, it sounds like you want to change your situation but don't necessarily know how. Is that accurate?
Yeah, I guess so. I mean, I don't want to feel like this forever but I don't know where to start or what to do differently.
"Well, let's start by exploring why you feel this way and see if we can come up with some ideas together on how to improve your situation. Sound good?
I'm just feeling really down lately. I don't know how to get out of this funk."
It sounds like you've been through a lot lately. Tell me more about what's been going on.

Well, my mom died a few months ago and that was really hard. I'm also in the middle of getting a divorce, which has been really tough. I just feel like everything is falling apart and I don't know how to fix it.

It sounds like you're feeling really hopeless right now. But it's important to remember that things can get better. We can work together to help you develop some coping mechanisms and start rebuilding your life. You don't have to do this alone.
That sounds really good. I'm not sure where to even start, but I'm willing to try anything.
"Great! Let's start by exploring your feelings about what's been going on. We can talk about what's been the most difficult for you and develop a plan from there.
I just feel so hopeless right now. I can't seem to shake these negative thoughts and I don't know what to do."
It sounds like you're feeling really overwhelmed. Can you tell me more about what's going on?
It's just been a tough few weeks. I've been having a lot of trouble at work and my personal life has been kind of chaotic. I just feel like I can't catch a break.
It sounds like you're feeling really stressed out. Have you been able to take any time for yourself lately?
No, not really. I've been trying to juggle everything and I just feel like I'm failing at everything.
It sounds like you're feeling really hard on yourself right now. Can you tell me more about that?

I just feel like no matter what I do, it's never good enough. I'm always screwing up or falling short somehow. And lately it feels like everything is spiraling out of control and I can't keep up anymore.

Rima, it sounds like you're feeling really down on yourself right now and that's impacting how you're seeing things in your life. We can work on helping you shift your perspective and start seeing things in a more positive light again. Would that be something you'd be interested in doing?
Yes, I think that would help. I'm just so tired of feeling like this all the time.
"Okay, let's start by exploring some of these negative thoughts you've been having. Can you tell me more about why you feel like you're always screwing up or falling short?
I've been feeling really down lately. I'm not sure what's wrong."
It sounds like you're experiencing some symptoms of anxiety and depression. Do you want to talk about what's going on?
Everything just feels so overwhelming. I can't concentrate at work, and I'm constantly worrying about things. I just feel so hopeless.
It sounds like you're going through a lot right now. Let's talk about some coping strategies that might help you feel better. Have you tried exercise or relaxation techniques?
I've tried both, but nothing seems to help. I just can't seem to shake this feeling.
It's understandable that you're feeling this way. Let's talk about some other options that might help you feel better. Have you considered medication or therapy?
I'm not sure if I want to go that route. I'm just not sure if it will really help.
"That's a valid concern. Why don't we talk about it more and see if it's something that could work for you?
I'm just so tired all the time. I can't focus on anything and I don't enjoy anything anymore."
Morris, it sounds like you're experiencing depression. Can you tell me more about how you're feeling?
I just feel empty all the time. Everything feels pointless. I can't concentrate on anything or find any joy in anything.

That definitely sounds like depression. Morris, depression is a very common condition, but it's also very treatable. I'm going to help you understand your feelings and teach you some coping mechanisms that will help you feel better.
Thank you, counselor. Just talking to you makes me feel a little better already.
"That's great, Morris! We'll work together to get you feeling back to your old self again in no time.
So, I guess the first thing I wanted to talk about is just how I've been feeling lately. It's been really tough and I just feel like I'm not myself."
What specifically has been tough for you? Can you give me some examples?

Well, lately I've just been feeling really down and hopeless. Everything feels like such a struggle and I don't know how to make it better. I've been having a lot of negative thoughts and it's just hard to shake them off. And on top of that, my anxiety has been through the roof. I'm constantly on edge and feeling like something bad is going to happen. It's just really hard to cope with everything.

I'm sorry to hear that you're going through all of this. It sounds like it's been a really tough time for you. But it sounds like you're doing your best to manage everything, which is commendable. Can you tell me more about these negative thoughts you've been having? What do they say specifically?

They just tell me that I'm not good enough, that I'll never be able to improve my situation. They tell me that I'm worthless and that nobody cares about me. And lately, it's just been really hard to push those thoughts away.

It sounds like you're experiencing a lot of negative self-talk. That can be tough to deal with, but it's important to remember that those thoughts are not necessarily true. Just because you have those thoughts doesn't mean they're accurate representations of reality. Can you think of any evidence that disproves those negative thoughts?

Well, my friends and family have always been there for me and they care about me a lot. And I know that I've achieved things in the past despite feeling like this, so I know it's possible to overcome these feelings.

Exactly. Just because you're feeling down doesn't mean you can't still achieve great things. It sounds like you have a lot of people in your life who care about you, which is really positive. Have you been reaching out to them for support?
Yeah, I've been trying to talk to them more lately and lean on them when I'm feeling down. It definitely helps to know that they're there for me no matter what.
"That's good to hear. It sounds like you're surrounded by people who love and support you, which is really important during tough times like this.
Hey, thanks for seeing me today. I'm really not sure what to talk about, but I guess I've been feeling kind of down lately."
That's perfectly understandable. Why don't you tell me a little bit about what's been going on?

Well, I guess things have just been really tough lately. My parents are getting divorced, and it's just been really hard to deal with. On top of that, I've been having some problems with my friends. It feels like they're always excluding me and talking about me behind my back. It just sucks feeling like I'm the one always left out.

It sounds like you're carrying a lot of hurt and resentment right now. That can be tough to deal with, but it sounds like you're handling it all very well considering how much is going on in your life. Have you talked to your friends about how you're feeling? They might not even realize that they're hurting your feelings.
No, I haven't said anything to them yet...I don't know if it would even make a difference. They seem so happy without me anyway.
Well, it definitely couldn't hurt to try talking to them about how you feel. They might be more understanding than you think and maybe even apologize for unintentionally hurting your feelings
Yeah, I guess you're right. It's worth a shot, right? Thanks for talking with me today. I feel a little better already.
"You're welcome, Emile. I'm here for you anytime you need to talk.
I just feel so down lately. I'm struggling in school and I feel like I'm not good enough."
It sounds like you're feeling pretty frustrated with yourself right now. Can you tell me more about why you think you're not good enough?
I just can't seem to get my grades up no matter how hard I try. And everyone else seems to be doing better than me. It feels like I'm just not cut out for this.

Well, first of all, it's important to remember that everyone learns at their own pace and that comparison is often counterproductive. Secondly, your grades are not necessarily indicative of your intelligence or worth as a person. They can be improved with hard work and dedication.
But it feels like I've been trying so hard and it's just not enough. I don't know what else to do.
It sounds like you're feeling really stuck right now. Have you considered seeking out tutoring or academic support? Sometimes having some extra help can make all the difference.
Yeah, maybe that could help...I don't know, I just feel so down about all of this right now. Counseling seems like such a big step...I don't know if I'm ready for that yet.

Well, that's understandable. Counseling can be a big commitment. But it can also be incredibly helpful in situations like this. It sounds like you're really struggling right now and could benefit from some professional support.
I guess...I'm just not sure if I'm ready to take that step yet.
"That's okay, there's no pressure to make a decision right now. Just know that we're here for you when you're ready.
I'm really not comfortable talking about my personal issues with a stranger."

I understand that you may feel uncomfortable discussing your problems with someone you don't know, but it's important to remember that therapist-client confidentiality is very important. Anything you say in here stays between us.
I'm still not sure if I'm ready to talk about everything.
That's perfectly understandable. Sometimes it takes a little while to build up trust with your therapist. Why don't we start by talking about why you came to see me today?
I guess I just wanted someone to talk to about my problems. I'm really struggling right now and I don't feel like I have anyone to talk to.
That sounds very difficult. Can you tell me more about what's going on?
I don't know, it's just everything. My job, my relationship, my friends, it all feels like it's falling apart and I don't know what to do.
It sounds like you're feeling very overwhelmed and hopeless right now. Have you been having any suicidal thoughts?
Yes, lately I've been thinking about killing myself a lot. But I would never actually do it, I'm just so tired of feeling this way all the time.

"It's understandable that you would be feeling that way given everything that's going on in your life, but it's important for you to know that there are other options besides suicide. We can work together to help you find other ways to cope with your pain.
I really appreciate you seeing me, counselor. I know I've been through a lot and I need to figure out how to be a better person."
I'm glad you came in, Bradley. Let's talk about what's been going on in your life. You said you want to be a better person. What do you mean by that?
I mean that I want to improve myself in every way possible. I want to be happier, healthier, and more successful. And I know that counseling can help me get there.
That's great! So, where would you like to start?
Well, I guess we can start with my childhood. I had a really tough time growing up. My parents were always fighting and I never felt like I fit in.
That sounds difficult. How did that make you feel?
It made me feel really alone and like there was something wrong with me. I was always trying to figure out what I could do to make my parents happy, but it never seemed to work.
That must have been really hard for you. Can you tell me more about how that affected your life?
It made me not want to get close to people because I was afraid they would leave me too. And it also made me really angry all the time. I used to lash out at people and get into fights a lot.
So, you've struggled with anger issues in the past?
Yeah, definitely. It's something that I've been working on for a long time now. But it's still something that I struggle with sometimes.
What do you do when you're feeling angry?

Well, nowadays, I try to take some deep breaths and count to 10 before doing anything else. That usually helps calm me down enough so that I don't do or say anything rash. But sometimes it doesn't work and I still end up getting angry anyway.

"That's understandable. Anger is a normal emotion and it's okay to feel it from time to time. Just be careful not to let it take over your life or lead to negative behaviors like violence or verbal abuse
I don't know, it just seems like lately I can't help but get angry over everything. Everything just sets me off and I can't control it."
What do you think is causing this increase in anger?
I don't know. It's just everything, like I said. Everything bothers me and makes me mad.
Is there anything in particular that seems to trigger your anger?

Yeah, there are definitely certain things that will set me off more than others. For example, if someone cuts me off in traffic or if someone is being really loud and obnoxious, those things will definitely make me angrier than other things. But really, anything can set me off at this point.
So it sounds like you're feeling a lot of frustration and annoyance in your day-to-day life. Is that accurate?

Yes, that's definitely accurate. I'm just so frustrated all the time and I don't know how to deal with it constructively. Nothing seems to be going my way lately and it's really taking a toll on me emotionally.
Well, let's talk about some ways that you can deal with your anger constructively rather than letting it build up inside of you until it explodes. What do you think would work for you?

Well, I guess first of all, I need to be more aware of when I'm getting angry so that I can try to stop myself before it gets too bad. Secondly, once I am aware that I'm getting angry, I need to take some deep breaths and try to calm myself down before doing or saying anything rash. And finally, even after I've calmed down, if the thing that made me angry is still bothering me, then maybe talking about it calmly with the person who upset me or with somebody else who was involved in the situation could help diffuse the anger even further.
"Those are all great suggestions! Let's try implementing them the next time you start to feel yourself getting angry and see how they work for you.
I'm really glad I decided to come here today. I feel like I finally have some hope for the first time in a long time."
I'm glad to hear that, Makaylee. Can you tell me what's been going on that's been causing you so much distress?
It's just been hard lately. I've been feeling really down and helpless and like nothing is ever going to get better.
That sounds very difficult. But it sounds like you're starting to see that things can improve with counseling.
Yeah, I am. I think part of what has helped is just finally talking to someone about everything that's going on. It feels good to be heard and understood.

Absolutely. That's a big part of what counseling can offer- a safe place to share your thoughts and feelings without judgement or criticism. Just being able to talk openly about what's going on can be very helpful in itself.
Yeah, I definitely feel like it has been. Just having that outlet to talk about everything has made a big difference.
I'm glad to hear that. Are there any other things that you feel have been helpful in your session today?
I think just the fact that you were really listening and didn't try to fix everything or tell me what to do. It was really refreshing to just be heard without judgement.

That's great feedback, thank you. I think it's important for people to feel like they can be themselves without feeling like they need to put on a front or pretend to be someone they're not. So hearing that you felt comfortable being yourself with me is very gratifying.
Yeah, it definitely makes me want to come back and continue counseling. I think it could really help me in the long run.
"That's great news, Makaylee! I'm so glad you're feeling hopeful and motivated to continue counseling.
It feels like I can't ever say the right thing. I'll try to have a conversation with someone, and it just ends up in a fight. I don't know how to make friends or keep them."
It sounds like you feel like you're struggling in your relationships with others. Can you tell me more about that? What do you think might be causing some of the conflict?

I don't know. It just seems like no matter what I say, it always ends up wrong somehow. I must be doing something wrong, but I don't know what it is. Maybe there's something wrong with me that makes people not want to be around me.
That's a possibility, but we won't know for sure until we explore it further. Let's talk about some of your specific relationships that have been causing you difficulty. Can you give me an example?
Well, there's my family. We're always fighting about something or other. And my friends from school…I used to have a lot of them, but now it feels like they're all drifting away and I don't know why.
It sounds like you're feeling really alone right now. Have there been any changes in your life recently that might have contributed to this feeling?

I don't know. Everything just feels so different lately. My dad lost his job, and we're struggling to make ends meet. That's been hard on all of us. And then my best friend moved away, and it feels like everyone else is changing too.

"It sounds like you've experienced a lot of loss recently. That can be really tough to deal with. Let's talk about how you're coping with all of these changes. Have you been talking to anyone about how you're feeling?
Hi, counselor. I'm really struggling and I feel like I need help."
Thank you for coming in, Johana. Can you tell me what's going on?

I've just been really stressed lately. I have a lot going on in my life and I feel like I can't cope with it all. Everything feels like it's piling up on me and I can't handle it anymore. I'm just so tired all the time and I don't know what to do.

It sounds like you're feeling overwhelmed and hopeless. That can be really tough to deal with. Let's talk about some of the things that are stressing you out. Maybe we can brainstorm some ways to help you cope with them better.

Well, one of the big things is my job. I work in customer service and it's just so stressful. I deal with angry customers all day and it's really taking a toll on me. I feel like I'm just constantly yelling at people and I hate it.
It sounds like your job is really affecting your mental state. Have you considered looking for a new job?
Yeah, I've been thinking about it but I'm not sure what else I would do. I need something that pays well and customer service is the only thing I've ever done.

That's understandable. It can be hard to make a career change, but sometimes it's necessary for our mental health. Let's brainstorm some other options for you. What are some other things you're interested in?
I don't know...I've always liked working with kids so maybe something in that field?
That's definitely a possibility! There are lots of jobs working with children that could be less stressful than customer service. Do you have any experience working with kids?
No, not really...I used to babysit when I was younger but that's about it.
"That's okay! There are plenty of entry-level jobs in childcare that don't require much experience. Let's look into some of those options and see if any of them seem like a good fit for you.
I don't see why I have to be here. I'm not the one with the problem."
Sheila, you were caught smoking cigarettes behind the school. That's a serious offense. If you're expelled, it will go on your record and follow you for the rest of your life.
So what? It's not like I'm going to college or anything.

Even if you're not planning on going to college, a criminal record can still make it difficult to get a job later on down the road. Not to mention, it would be a real shame to throw away your future over something like this.
I don't care about my future. What's the point? Everything sucks anyways.

Sheila, life isn't always easy, but that doesn't mean it's not worth living. You have so much potential and I would hate to see you throw it all away because you're feeling angry or frustrated right now. There's help available if you're willing to accept it.
I don't need help. I can handle things on my own.
Sheila, you're only sixteen. You're not supposed to have everything figured out yet. That's what we're here for, to help guide you through these tough times.
I don't want your help. I can do this on my own.
"Okay, Sheila, if that's how you feel then there's not much more we can do here. But I want you to know that we're here for you if you ever change your mind and decide that you need our help.
I just feel like nobody really gets me. My family, my friends...they all just see the world differently than I do. And I don't know how to make them understand me."
It sounds like you're feeling very misunderstood. Can you tell me more about that? What specifically makes you feel this way?

Well, it's like...I'll give you an example. Recently, one of my friends said something that really hurt my feelings. And when I tried to talk to her about it, she just didn't get it. She was like, "I was just joking! Why are you getting so upset?" And I was like, "Because what you said wasn't funny to me." But she just couldn't understand why I felt that way. It was frustrating.
I see. So it sounds like you feel like your friend wasn't able to empathize with how you were feeling.

Yeah, exactly. And it's not just that one instance, either. I feel like this happens a lot with the people in my life. They just don't seem to get how I'm feeling or why I'm feeling that way. And it makes me feel alone and lost and frustrated.
"Akilah, it sounds like you're struggling with communication in your relationships. Do you want to talk about some strategies for how to better communicate with the people in your life?
I just feel like I'm not good enough. No matter what I do, it's never enough."
It sounds like you're really hard on yourself. Do you think that might be part of the problem?
Yeah, I guess so. I just feel like I can never measure up.
So it sounds like you're constantly comparing yourself to others and coming up short. Is that accurate?
Yeah, pretty much. I see other people and they seem to have their act together and be successful and happy, and I just feel like a failure in comparison.

That's a very common feeling, but it's important to remember that everyone has their own struggles and journey in life. Just because someone else appears to have things together doesn't mean they don't have their own issues going on beneath the surface. So instead of comparing yourself to others, focus on your own progress and journey. How far have you come? What are some accomplishments or positive changes you've made in your life? Celebrate those things instead of fixating on what you perceive as someone else's success.
Yeah, that makes sense. I guess I've been so focused on what everyone else has that I haven't taken the time to appreciate my own accomplishments.
"Exactly. So why don't we take a few minutes and brainstorm some of your accomplishments?
I don't really know where to start. I guess I've just been feeling down and anxious a lot lately. It's been hard to focus on anything or enjoy anything."
That sounds tough. Can you tell me more about why you're feeling this way?
Well, I'm going through some major changes in my life right now. My parents are getting divorced, and I'm having to switch schools. It's all just been really overwhelming and stressful.
That definitely sounds like a lot to deal with. How have you been coping with all of these changes?
Not very well, to be honest. I've been trying to keep busy and distract myself, but it's not really helping. I just feel so lost and alone right now.
It sounds like you're feeling pretty overwhelmed by everything that's going on in your life right now. Have you talked to anyone else about how you're feeling?
No, not really. I don't want to burden anyone else with my problems, and I'm afraid they won't understand or be able to help me anyway.
"Well, it's good that you came here today then. We can talk about whatever is on your mind and try to figure out some ways for you to cope with all of this change in your life.
I'm really struggling right now and I'm not sure what to do."
It sounds like you're feeling lost and hopeless. Can you tell me more about what's going on?
I just feel like I can't do anything right. No matter what I do, it feels like it's not good enough. I know my family loves me, but I feel like they'd be better off without me.

Traci, it sounds like you're experiencing a lot of self-doubt and negative self-talk. These are common symptoms of depression and anxiety. It's important to remember that your thoughts are not necessarily accurate or true. Just because you think something doesn't make it so.
But it feels so real to me. Like there's this voice in my head telling me I'm worthless and that everyone would be better off without me.

Yes, those voices can be very convincing, but we need to remember that they're just thoughts, not reality. Depression and anxiety can distort our thinking and make us believe things that aren't true. That's why it's so important to get help from a professional who can help you learn how to manage your thoughts and feelings in a more healthy way.
I guess I never really thought of it that way. It makes sense that my thoughts wouldn't be accurate if I'm feeling so down all the time.

"Exactly. Just because you're thinking something doesn't make it true. That's why it's so important to get help from a professional who can help you learn how to manage your thoughts and feelings in a more healthy way.
Hi, I'm Audrina. I'm here to see the therapist."
Hello, Audrina. Please have a seat and we'll get started. So, what brings you in today?

Well, I've been feeling really down lately and I just can't seem to snap out of it. Everything feels hopeless and I don't know who to talk to about it. I thought maybe counseling could help me sort things out.
I see. Well, Audrina, we'll do our best to help you through whatever is troubling you. Can you tell me more about what's been going on?

It's just, ever since my dad died, I've felt like I'm just going through the motions of life. I don't feel like I'm really living anymore. I know it's been a few years, but it feels like yesterday sometimes. I miss him so much.
Yes, it sounds like you're still grieving his loss. That can be very difficult to deal with. Have you been doing anything to help cope with your grief?
Yeah, I've been going to therapy for a while now and that's helped some. But lately, I just feel like I'm stuck in this dark place and I can't seem to find my way out.

It sounds like you're feeling very lost and alone right now. That's understandable given what you're going through. Grief can be a very isolating experience. Have you been reaching out to family and friends for support?

Yeah, but it's hard because they're all dealing with their own stuff too and they can't really relate to what I'm going through. Sometimes I feel like they just want me to get over it already and move on with my life.

That must be really tough for you to deal with. It sounds like you need some understanding and support that maybe your family and friends can't give right now. Maybe we can work on that in counseling?
"Yeah, that would be great actually. Just knowing that somebody understands what I'm going through would mean a lot to me right now
I'm really struggling lately. I just can't seem to make myself happy no matter what I do."
It sounds like you're feeling pretty hopeless right now. What's been going on that's been causing you so much pain?
It's just everything. My job, my relationships, nothing feels good anymore. I used to be able to find joy in things, but now it all seems pointless.

You sound like you're in a really dark place right now. But I want you to know that there is hope and we can work together to help you find your way back to the light. Let's talk about some of the specific things that have been bothering you. What's been going on at work?

Work has just been really stressful lately. I feel like I'm never doing enough, no matter how hard I try. And my boss is always on my case about something or other. It feels like everything I do is wrong.

That sounds very difficult to deal with on a daily basis. No wonder you're feeling so down about everything if work is such a source of stress for you. Let's talk about your relationships too. How are things going with your friends and family?

Not great either, actually...I've been having some disagreements with my friends lately and it's really strained those relationships. And as for family, well...my parents are getting divorced, so that's not exactly easy to deal with either!

Yeah, that definitely sounds like a lot to deal with all at once! No wonder you're feeling overwhelmed and depressed. But it sounds like you're handling all of this incredibly well considering how much stress you're under."
Thank you, I appreciate that. It's just really hard sometimes, feeling like I can't make things better no matter how hard I try.

"Yes, I can imagine that would be incredibly frustrating and discouraging. But remember, you're not alone in this. We're here to help you every step of the way. Just take it one day at a time and trust that things will eventually get better.

I'm really proud of the progress I've made in counseling. I feel like I've really opened up and been honest about my feelings and what's going on in my life. My counselor has been a great help in providing me with guidance and support."
That's great to hear, Macario. Can you tell me more about what you feel you've accomplished in counseling?

Well, like I said, I feel like I've been more honest about my feelings and what's going on in my life. I think that's been a big help in itself. Just being able to talk openly and honestly about things has made me feel better. And my counselor has been really helpful in providing me with guidance and support.
That sounds like it's been very beneficial for you. Are there any specific areas that you feel you've made progress in?

Yeah, I think just overall my mental health has improved. I'm feeling less anxious and stressed than I used to. And I'm also sleeping better now, which is something that was really affecting me before. So overall, just feeling better mentally and physically.
That sounds excellent, Macario! It sounds like counseling is really helping you in a lot of ways. Are there any other benefits that you've noticed?

"Yeah, I think counseling has also helped me be more mindful of my thoughts and actions. Like, before I would sometimes do things without thinking about the consequences or how it would affect other people. But now I'm more aware of those things and try to make sure that my actions are positive and not harmful to others. So overall just feeling more mindful and conscientious of my thoughts and actions.
I just feel so hopeless. I don't know what to do with my life."
Why do you feel that way, Ameir?
I just don't see any point in anything. Everything feels so pointless and I can't seem to find any meaning in anything.
That sounds very difficult. Can you tell me more about how you're feeling?
I just feel like there's nothing good in my life. I'm stuck in this dead-end job, I have no friends or family, and I just can't seem to find any joy in anything. It all feels so pointless.
It sounds like you're feeling quite lonely and down on yourself. Have you been getting out and doing things that make you happy?
No, not really. I've been too scared to try new things because I'm afraid of failing or being rejected. So, I've just been staying home a lot lately and not really doing much of anything.

That isolation can definitely make things worse when we're already feeling down on ourselves. Maybe we can work on some coping skills for when those negative feelings come up so that you don't get pulled into that dark place again? Would that be something you'd be interested in?
Yeah, I think that would help. I really don't want to feel like this anymore.

"Okay, let's start with some deep breathing exercises. Close your eyes and take a few deep breaths in through your nose and out through your mouth. Slowly count to four as you inhale and then count to eight as you exhale.
